answer.body:
You may wish to reach out to your card-issuing bank to check on the current status of your card.
 
Alternatively, we would suggest removing and re-adding the card to the app, or to use a different card to see if the issue persists.


You can do so by following these few steps:

  1. Tap on the Menu button on the top left corner of the app, this is shown as an icon with three lines.

  2. Tap on Remove Card. Your card details will be shown as a confirmation. Tap on Remove to proceed.

  3. Tap on the Menu button on the top left corner of the app again

  4. Tap on Add Card and key in your card details.

  5. Kindly try to book another parking session.

 
If the above steps did not work, kindly try closing/exiting the app fully and relaunching the app.

Otherwise, please email feedback@parking.sg with the following details so that we can investigate further:

  • Card type e.g Passion Debit card, Singtel Dash, Revolut

  • Card issuing bank/company:

  • iPhone / Android model

  • iOS / Android OS:

  • Parking.sg version (found on top right corner of start page)

  • Screenshot of issue/error message

  • Vehicle number

questionListItems.title: Can you add an alert in this apps. To remind user times up!!

answer.body:
Parking.sg does notify users 10 mins prior to the end of their parking session. This is so that users can extend their sessions if required.
 
However, to receive such notifications, please ensure that you have allowed Push notifications for the Parking.sg app as well as set your phone timing to be on network mode so that the timing is in sync. This can be done via your phone settings.
 
For time synchronisation:
 
For Android:
Please ensure that your Android smartphone is connected to network (either by Mobile Data or WiFi) before you proceed:

  1. Tap on the Settings icon on the main screen.

  2. In the Search bar, type in Date & Time and tap on it
    (Your phone's Settings may differ depending on the manufacturer and Android version)

  3. Find Automatic date & time and tap to disable it. Tap again to re-enable it.

  4. Find Automatic time zone and tap to disable it. Tap again to re-enable it.

  5. Ensure that time zone is set to Singapore, GMT +08:00.

 
For iPhone:
Please ensure that your Android smartphone is connected to network (either by Mobile Data or WiFi) before you proceed:

  1. Ensure that you have the most updated version of the iOS.

  2. Tap on the Settings icon on the main screen. Proceed to General > Date & Time.

  3. Tap on Set Automatically.
    This automatically sets your date and time based on your time zone. If there is an available time zone update, your device will prompt you.

  4. Tap on the Settings icon on the main screen again. Proceed to Privacy > Location Services > System Services and select Setting Time Zone.
    This will allow your device to use its current location to determine the correct time zone.

  5. Check that your device shows the correct time zone in Settings > General > Date & Time > Time Zone.

 
Do fully exit the Parking.sg app if it is open and relaunch it so that the app is now synchronised with the timing.

questionListItems.title: I was informed that the transaction was unsuccessful due to insufficient balance in my card. I have topped up my card, May I know if you will try to deduct the amount again?

answer.body: Yes, the system will revert back to the normal deduction for individual transactions. There will not be any action required on your end.

questionListItems.title:
I m a foreigner who is not eligible for concessionary season parking, we used to use coupons for parking and it lasts for a whole day.
For now,  If I park my motorcycle for more than 4 hrs per location and more than 1 location per day, how will the fares be calculated? Do I pay $0.65 x 2 times instead?

answer.body: The parking charges are calculated per car park and capped at $0.65 per day or night session. This means that you will need to start a new parking session each time you park at a new location. If you park your motorcycle for more than 4 hours at a location or at more than one location per day, you will need to pay $0.65 for each parking session. To avoid any confusion or additional charges, make sure to start a new parking session each time you park at a new location.

questionListItems.title: Are we allowed to cover our vehicles(motorcycle) in Open Free parking lot?

answer.body: Yes, you can cover your motorcycle when you park in public car parks. Just make sure to have a valid parking session when you park and leave the vehicle.

questionListItems.title: Car park at HDB/JTC estate and ERP charges. How to locate and print out?

answer.body:
You have a couple of options:

  • Press the receipt button at the terminal station where you paid the charge to obtain a receipt.

  • Go to any NET's top-up machine to print out past transactions.

questionListItems.title: The app hang and I am not able to start another session?

answer.body:
If your Parking.sg app freezes or crashes, try fully closing the app and relaunching it. Here's how:


For Android:

  1. Go to your home screen.

  2. Tap the square icon at the bottom of the screen.

  3. Tap the Bin icon at the bottom to close all existing apps or swipe up on the app you want to close.


For iPhone:

  1. Go to your home screen.

  2. Swipe up from the bottom of the screen and pause in the middle.

  3. Swipe through your open apps.

  4. Locate the app you wish to close by swiping left or right.

  5. Swipe up on the app you want to close.

  6. Tap the display to return to the home screen.


Make sure your phone's Operating System and Parking.sg app are up-to-date to minimize app freezes and crashes. If the issue persists, consider deleting and reinstalling the Parking.sg app.

questionListItems.title: How can I seek refund for overpaid parking?
questionListItems.body: I have forgotten to terminate my parking session and I overpaid my parking fee. How can I seek a refund?

answer.body: Unfortunately, we can't provide a refund in this case based on our refund guidelines. We understand that it's frustrating, but we hope you can understand our policy. To avoid overpaying parking fees in the future, we recommend setting a reminder on your phone or turn on our app notifications. This way, you can avoid overpaying and ensure that you only pay for the time you've used. Thank you for your understanding.

questionListItems.title: How do I activate the night parking? What is the parking rate for night parking using this app?

answer.body: The app does provide overnight parking. It factors in the tariff rate, operating hours, restrictions, and parking scheme of each car park to automatically compute parking charges. If a car park has an overnight parking scheme, the app will cap the parking fee once the duration exceeds the overnight parking rate. You can be sure that the app won't overcharge you for parking.

questionListItems.title: How to change my carplate number

answer.body:
To update your vehicle information, you can easily delete your existing vehicle and enter the new information. Here's how:


  1. Open the app and go to the main page.

  2. Find your existing vehicle number field and tap on it.

  3. A list of your saved vehicles will appear. Click on the "X" beside the vehicle you want to delete.

  4. Once the old vehicle number is deleted, you may add a new vehicle by tapping on “Use a new vehicle” or select from the existing list of vehicles.


That's it! Your new vehicle information is now updated in the app.

questionListItems.title: Trying to transact thru card but was declined never have this problem
questionListItems.body: Trying to transact thru card but was declined never have this problem

answer.body:
Here are some steps you can take:

  • Contact your card-issuing bank to check the status of your card.

  • Try removing and re-adding the card to the app, or use a different card to see if the issue persists. Here's how:

    • Tap on the Menu button (icon with three lines) on the top left corner of the app.

    • Tap on Remove Card and confirm removal.

    • Tap on Add Card and enter your card details.

    • Try to book another parking session.

If the above steps don't work, try closing the app fully and relaunching it. Make sure both your phone's operating system and the Parking.sg app are up to date. If the issue persists, consider deleting the Parking.sg app and reinstalling it to start fresh. We apologize for any inconvenience and thank you for your patience.

questionListItems.title: My records show that I need to pay $3.60 for parking at Chinatown area on 3rd May, but $4.20 was deducted from my account on 6th May. May I know why?

answer.body:
If you received a higher charge than expected for your parking, this is just the app's batching process. The app batches multiple past parking sessions into a single card statement to reduce clutter on your statements. Sessions will be batched every $5 or 2 days, whichever comes first. So, it's possible that you were charged for multiple sessions on a single day.


To review your parking history and see the details of your charges, follow these steps:

  1. Open the Parking.sg app and go to the "History" page.

  2. Click on the "BILL" tab to view your bills.

  3. Look for the specific bill ID that corresponds to the charge on your credit card statement.

  4. You may find that some bill IDs contain only one session, whereas others are a combination of two or more sessions. If you're still unsure about your charges, you can contact the Parking.sg support team for further assistance.


However, if you still feel that the charges are wrong, please email feedback@parking.sg with the following details:

  1. Picture of your card statement (please exclude sensitive information)

  2. Screenshot of your history in the parking app

  3. Vehicle number

questionListItems.title: My card is added successfully but when it comes to payment, an error message shows 'oops card is declined.' how to resolve this?

answer.body:
Here are some steps you can take:

  1. Contact your card-issuing bank to check the status of your card.

  2. Try removing and re-adding the card to the app, or use a different card to see if the issue persists. Here's how:

    1. Tap on the Menu button (icon with three lines) in the top left corner of the app

    2. Tap on Remove Card and confirm removal

    3. Tap on Add Card and enter your card details

    4. Try to book another parking session

If the above steps don't work, try closing the app fully and relaunching it. Make sure both your phone's operating system and the Parking.sg app are up to date. If the issue persists, consider deleting the Parking.sg app and reinstalling it to start fresh.
We accept credit cards, debit cards from Visa, Mastercard, and American Express, as well as Singtel Dash and Grabpay.
To delete bills, go to your Parking app history and click on ‘delete’ for the specific bill you wish to remove. Alternatively, if you can re-install the app to delete all the bills at once.
